intro: Thuranthos coromandelianus, commonly known as the Coromandel thurantos, is a flowering plant native to the eastern coast of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
